What are you looking for? Advanced Search Home > All Categories > Dining Out > Fast Food > Resolved Question You K Member since: July 10, 2008 Total points: 100 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Resolved Question Show me another » What are some of the differences between fast food and home-cooked meals? Im doing a research paper and I just wanted to have some points of view from other people. 4 years ago Report Abuse by Felix Member since: February 17, 2007 Total points: 237,040 (Level 7) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters fast food is more expensive and much worse for you.. 4 years ago Report Abuse 29% 2 Votes Action Bar: 0 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! Add to Del.icio.us RSS
There are currently no comments for this question.
* You must be logged into Answers to add comments. Sign in or Register .
Other Answers (9) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by babymed1... Member since: June 03, 2008 Total points: 1,355 (Level 3) Add Contact Block I know that there are alot of contraindications for eating fast food based upon nutrional value, but I would like to put a spin on it for a minute.
One positive thing is that it provides working single mothers like myself a quicker way to feed the family. There are some good choices out there now for example McDonalds now is changing the choices in the happy meal. Subway provides low fat subs and even Taco Bell has a way of reducing the calories. Of course you can't eat there everyday and if you do it doesn't help if you don't make the healthier choice. 4 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote by Chuck P Member since: March 05, 2007 Total points: 44,545 (Level 7) Add Contact Block Home cooked usually refers to made from scratch not processed food. Although some of the ingredients still come from cans it is usually more nutritious than fast food. Fast food often adds extra fat and salt for flavor along with preservatives. They are moving towards even more processed and fast frozen foods that deteriorate the nutrients even further. They deceive the public by claiming or naming the food as being healthy while knowing full well they are not even close. Buyer beware when eating at any of those so called fast food places, Mexican and Burger places are the worst for processing and adding fat. Small single operators are not to be confused with the large chains that actually have their own commissaries. 4 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by ♥ilu♥ Member since: July 03, 2008 Total points: 160 (Level 1) Add Contact Block Here are the advantages of home-cooked meals: http://www.articlestree.com/food-and-drinks/stop-the-eating-out-madness-the-benefits-of-preparing-home-cooked-meals-tx391598.html
Fast food,why it's unhealthy: http://www.pamf.org/preteen/mybody/nutrition/fastfood.html http://news.minnesota.publicradio.org/features/2004/12/30_scheckt_mcstudy/
Good luck on your research parer! 4 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote by Softball Chick Member since: July 07, 2008 Total points: 893 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Fast food is cheap imitation meat and calories that are unwanted. Home cooked meals are healthier and taste better because you know what goes in it and if it's cooked right. Home-cooked is way better than fast food! 4 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote by minnie mouse Member since: May 26, 2008 Total points: 1,855 (Level 3) Add Contact Block well home made meals u know how its cooked in what its cooked and by whom it gets taste, fast food, u will simply never know if the oil was new, was the pot clean and how many employee put their fingers in there 2 taste b4 it reached u? 4 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote 2 people rated this as good by ♥ Heaven ♥ Lee ♥ Member since: February 06, 2008 Total points: 20,630 (Level 6) Add Contact Block Home cooked meals can be much more nutritional. The ingredients used are more natural, as well. Not many fast food places will boil or steam food, like you can do at home. 4 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote 1 person rated this as good by Amanda M Member since: February 07, 2008 Total points: 1,554 (Level 3) Add Contact Block They use way more grease in restaurants, and its probably cleaner at home because you can see the food being made 4 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes by Amanda N Member since: June 13, 2008 Total points: 632 (Level 2) Add Contact Block Grease,Carbs,Not real meat,More Money,and the extra belly... 4 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 2 people rated this as good by 04758392... Member since: May 01, 2008 Total points: 6,283 (Level 5) Add Contact Block nothing really, it's just home cooked may be more convenient to make or something like that. 4 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes 1 person rated this as good
